column4: hello i got a hd wich is fully used by windows vista (80Gb) ntfs filesystem and i want to install ubuntu on it without deleting vista how can i do it?
just be prepared that it takes quite some time to resize a partition -
btw... would I get something like kubuntu if I've installed ubuntu and installed kde?
if glx gears shows above 10k fps - my gfx card is correctly installed ?
any way to check if my gfx card is correctly installed ?
ah... it doesn't work yet because it's still being updated via the packet manager ^
about shrinking c:\ i only can shrink 5 gigs while i got 40 gigs free space :|
i configured it to defragmentate each day do i still have to do it?
run a chkdsk too :D might give you some more free space
you can do this from the recovery console when booting from the windows disc
